caption.center: IN THE MATTER OF THE CLAIM OF TREDSUL G. HALL, Claimant,
LIBERTY MUTUAL INSURANCE COMPANY and/or WAUSAU INSURANCE

opinion.opinion_text:
FINAL ORDER
The respondent-insurers separately petitioned or review of an order of Administrative Law Judge Erickson (ALJ) dated July 14, 1998. The matter was subsequently transmitted to us for review. We dismiss the Petitions for Review.
Subsequent to our receipt of the record, the parties entered into an agreement for the full and final settlement of the claim. The settlement was approved by the Division of Workers' Compensation on December 30, 1998.
Thereafter, counsel for the Liberty Mutual Insurance Company filed a motion to withdraw their Petition for Review. In a letter dated January 22, 1998, Counsel for the Wausau Insurance Companies (Wausau) notified us that Wausau also seeks to withdraw it's appeal.
IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED that the petitions to review the ALJ's order dated July 14, 1998, are dismissed with prejudice.
INDUSTRIAL CLAIM APPEALS PANEL
____________________________________ Kathy E. Dean
____________________________________ Robert M. Socolofsky
NOTICE This Order is final unless an action to modify or vacate this Order is commenced in the Colorado Court of Appeals, 2 East 14th Avenue, Denver, CO 80203, by filing a petition for review with the court, with service of a copy of the petition upon the Industrial Claim Appeals Office and all other parties, within twenty (20) days after the date this Order is mailed, pursuant to section8-43-301(10) and 307, C.R.S. 1998.
Copies of this decision were mailed January 27, 1999 to the following parties:
Tredsul G. Hall, 1580 S. Hazel Court, Denver, CO 80203 80219
G-Tech Corp., 620 N. Santa Fe Avenue, Pueblo, CO 81003-4140
